subcategory: National Culture Limiting Female Workforce Participation

content.text: This refers to the limited participation of women in the labor force because of the national culture and associated stereotypes.
There are cultural stereotypes against women who work.
Women are compelled to give up their income to their families and don't have financial independence even if they are working.
Women are not seen as "respectable" if they go to work in many contexts.
Women often find that employers don't have the ability or will to address the needs of women employees.
The society needs to encourage women more via national level initiatives.
The government should introduce policies, guidelines, frameworks, and targets to enhance women’s participation in the workforce.
Community-level programs can be used as a step to address women's needs.
Multiple stakeholders need to work together to change men’s mentality to create a more inclusive, creative, and peaceful workspace for everyone.
The government can use examples of countries that have used feminist policies to empower their female population.
